passages.text: China (PRC) | Semiconductors
Emerging Global Leadershipin GaN for Next-Gen Tech Era

INNO's 1H25 rev grew 43% YoY, 16% > JEFe, and its GM turned positive 6.8% for the first time, also > JEFe. Net loss was bigger than JEFe but driven mainly by SBC and legal fees. It has started MP of GaN chips for Al servers and robotics. Mgt also see significant opportunities at NVDA, as GaN content potentially could grow >10x between GB and Ruben Ultra. We raise our PT based on 30% premium to our higher DCF, given inflection point of accelerated GaN adoption.

**1H25 results beat JEFe and show inflection point of accelerated wide adoption. InnoScience** (INNO) 1H25 rev grew 43%, driven by 49% growth in GaN chips and ICs, 123% growth in GaN modules but offset by a 21% fall in GaN wafers (some customers switched from wafers to chips/ICs). Strong module rev growth was likely driven by some delayed shipment from last year to a very large lithium battery maker, and the start of shipment to a cryto mining customer (both are 1200V products). GM's swing into positive territory at a faster pace was underpinned by rapid revenue growth but limited capex (thus D&A) in 1H25. We believe capex will start rising next year (2.5x growth from 2025) as mass production (MP) of new products for Al servers and EV should start ramping in 2026. We see GaN as an indispensable semi solution for efficient high-power transmission for next-gen tech applications including EV, Al servers and data centers, robotics (especially dexterous hands in humanoid robots, where space is limited) and solar. Hence, INNO as the world's largest and rapidly growing GaN IDM will likely play a dominant role in this fast-growing market.

**Significant opportunities at Al servers and data centers. In commenting on its cooperation** with NVDA, mgt highlighted accurate numbers are not yet available, but they see GaN being a critical element in NVDA's 800VDC architecture. Mgt also estimated the potential GaN content (areas that can deploy GaN) could grow more than 10x between the current NVL72 rack and its future Ruben Ultra design. Since the MP timing of Ruben Ultra is in 2H27, we believe NVDA will publish its final detailed design of the power rack in 2H25, so that the supply chain could get ready for component testing in 2026. This could be another positive catalyst for INNO, as the market will likely have better visibility of the GaN content in its design.

**Valuation may be hard to gauge given the early stage, but our unit economics analysis is** **positive and the stock will likely trade above our conservative DCF. On a scaled-up basis,** our unit economics analysis suggests an ROIC of 76%, while our model (extended to 2034) forecasts it would get there by 2033. But our model is likely still conservative. We est TAM of just Adversers and EV could be US$14bn, but our 2034E rev for INNO is only < US$2bn. Moreover, mass adoption of humanoid robots is not in our base case. Given bullish sentiment in Al China tech and accelerated mass adoption of GaN, our PT is based on a 30% premium to our conservative DCF value.
Equity ResearchAugust 31,2025

Edison Lee, CFA * | Equity Analyst
Nick Cheng * | Equity Analyst
Jacky He * | Equity Analyst
Matt Ma * | Equity Analyst
Annie Ping, CFA, FRM * | Equity Associate

- GaN is the next-gen power semi that provides low-cost, high-frequency, more efficient, and smaller device size to support migration to fast charging, EV, AI servers, robotics and solar. We set GaN's TAM of just EV and AI servers at US\(14bn. 
- InnoScience is by far the world's largest GaN IDM player in capacity (13kwpm), with capabilities in wafer, chip and modules. Its GaN products can cope with power level up to 1200v, vs competition at 800v. 
- Scale and the IDM status enable InnoScience to rapidly reduce cost, raise output, set standards, and accelerate GaN adoption. 
- InnoScience is the only Chinese semi company included in NVDA's power rack supply chain for its Ruben Ultra GPU (2027), and it has won multiple EV design-ins.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Total 8" GaN wafer capacity increases from 13kwpm by the end of 2024 to 88kwpm/128kwpm in 2030E/2034E. 
- Total utilization rate increases from 71% in 2024 to 83%/85% in 2030E/2034E. 
- Blended wafer ASP rises from Rmb9.8K in 2024 to Rmb10.1K/10.5K/11.3K in 2028E/2030E/2034E. 
- PT of HK\$109.53 is based on 30% premium to end-2026 DCF of HK\$84.25 with 9.3% WACC and 5.5% terminal growth rate, implying 24.3x 2034E P/E.

- Total 8" GaN wafer capacity increases from 13kwpm by the end of 2024 to 103kwpm/148kwpm in 2030E/2034E. 
- Total utilization rate increases from 70% in 2024 to 83%/85% in 2030E/2034E. 
- Blended wafer ASP changes from Rmb9.8k in 2024 to Rmb10.1K/11.1K/13.0K in 2028E/2030E/2034E. 
- PT of HK\$140.83 is based on end-2026 DCF of HK\$108.33 with 9.3% WACC and 5.5% terminal growth rate, implying 24.7x 2034E P/E.

- Total 8" GaN wafer capacity increases from 13kwpm in 2024 to 83kwpm/103kwpm in 2030E/2034E. 
- Total utilization rate increases from 71% in 2024 to 83%/85% in 2030E/2034E. 
- Blended wafer ASP stays stable from Rmb9.8k in 2024 to Rmb9.7K/9.2K/9.1K in 2028E/2030E/2034E. 
- PT of HK\$51.00 is based on no premium to end-2026 DCF with 9.3% WACC and 5.5% terminal growth rate, implying 22.7x 2034E P/E.

- Product quality: InnoScience established a robust quality management system based on market demand and leveraging its advanced quality management experience. 
- Resource consumption: InnoScience utilizes resources in daily operations for energy saving and consumption reduction to reduce resource usage. 
- Sustainable supply chain: InnoScience started to procure more raw materials from domestic suppliers due to their cost effectiveness.

- Targets 10% and 13% reductions in electricity and water consumption per million rev compared to 2023. 
- Targets a 15% reduction in gas consumption per million rev compared to 2023.

- What are InnoScience's ESG contribution targets? 
- What are InnoScience's ESG priorities for the next 5-10 years? ESG Report: 20241218063001_71550942_en.pdf

- Breaking into key local/global customers' supply chain in EV, appliances, and AIDC 
- NVDA will likely publish its detailed power rack design for its Ruben Ultra GPU (2027) in a few months, which will set out the areas that will deploy GaN 
- News about mass production of its GaN products for multiple Chinese EV players in 2026

InnoScience (Suzhou) Technology Holding Co., Ltd. manufactures, designs, distributes and sells power semiconductors. It focuses on the global power semiconductor revolution, dedicated to the innovation in the GaN power semiconductor industry and ecosystem. The company adopted an IDM model that provides in- house control over the entire process from design and manufacturing to packaging, testing and sales of finished products. Its integrated operational framework fosters coordination and synergy, ensuring the quality of power semiconductor products while providing stable production capacities, facilitating innovation through iterative design and process improvements and supporting cost- effective scaling. InnoScience products include GaN Product Types, GaN Wafers, GaN Discrete Chips and GaN ICs. The company was founded by Luo Wei Wei in July 21, 2017 and is headquartered in Suzhou, China.

Our price target is based on a \(30\%\) premium to end- 2026 DCF valuation, using WACC of \(9.3\%\) and \(5.5\%\) terminal growth rate in 2034E, implying \(24.3x\) 2034E P/E. Downside risks include: 1) slower- than- expected adoption of GaN in electric vehicles due to poor consumer demand for EVs and cost pressure of EV makers, 2) InnoScience fails to ramp up capacity and lower unit cost fast enough vs competitors, and 3) competitors such as Infineon being able to ramp up and achieve high yield at \(12^{\circ}\) faster than expected, which could erode InnoScience' competitive edge.

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.

Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
